result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melvin S Zarda

records.addlTxt: 11:01 AM Defendant Melvin S Zarda appears by video with attorney Breanna A. Halyburton appearing in court, in person.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin appears by video. Called 22CF03 State will proceed and has filed exhibit #1 Burnett county bond. Halyburton has seen that document - has no objections. Court accepts exhibit #1 which is bond from Burnett County. State calls Sgt. Kelly as first witness. Sworn in, 11:02 AM. State directs. Record reflects proper identification of defendant, 11:06 AM. Halyburton has no questions of this witness. State calls Deputy Doane as witness. Sworn in, 11:07 AM. State directs. Halyburton cross-examines witness, 11:11 AM. State re-directs, 11:13 AM. Halyburton makes brief argument, questions felony bail jumping burden has not met burden of proof. State responds. Court - finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Information has been filed. Halyburton will proceed to ARGN, waives reading of information and enters NG pleas. Court accepts pleas, will have set for JT and continues bond. Court now calls 22CF06 - State asks for 2 exhibits that were filed to be moved into evidence. No objection by Halyburton. Court accepts exhibit #1 and #2 (bonds from Forest County and Burnett County). State calls Det. Crum as witness. Sworn in, 11:18 AM. State directs. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant, 11:21 AM. Halyburton cross-examines, 11:24 AM. Court finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Information filed. Halyburton will proceed to ARGN, waives further reading of information and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, will have set for JT and continues bond.
Preliminary hearing on February 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.

09:06 AM Defendant Melvin S Zarda in court with attorney Beth Svehlek who appears specially today for Breanna A. Halyburton.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Melvin S Zarda appeared by video means with Attorney. Court calls 22CF03 and 22CF06. Zarda and Svehlek have complaints, waives reading of them, requests PH's on both, wants within time limits. Court continues bond on both cases, sets both cases for PH on 2/24/22 at 11:00 AM.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on February 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Absolute sobriety. No entry into any bars/taverns or casinos.

10:13 AM Defendant Melvin S Zarda appears by video.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin appears by video. All parties appear through zoom. Zarda has not received a copy of the complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. Zarda understands. Court questions if he has contacted an attorney. Zarda has representation in other cases Christopher Ness - public defender, has contacted SPD, waiting for them to appoint an attorney from SPD on this case. Court will continue bond, which has recently been posted.  Zarda would like to be heard on bond, asks for lower bond for food and other reasons as stated on the record. State - concerned, believes some cash is warranted but does not objection to reducing bond to $500 cash. Court questions Zarda on employment, questions who posted for him. Zarda responds most of the money was his, asked friends to help come up with the rest. State is also requesting conditions on bond of no consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars, taverns or casinos. Court modifies bond to $500 cash with conditions of: absolute sobriety and no entry into any bars, taverns or casinos. AIA set for 2/16/22 at 9:00 AM.  Zarda questions when the money will be sent to him. Clerk explains that their office has not received the bond money from FC jail at this time, asks that Zarda call the COC to get an update on when his refund can be picked up. Court also orders that Zarda must sign amended bond when he comes to pick up his check from COC office. Adjourned 10:23 AM.
Bail/bond hearing on January 11, 2022 at 10:15 am.
No consumption of alcohol. No entry into Mole Lake Casino. No contact with E.V. - REFUSED
